intro: Minuartia cismontana, commonly known as the Sierra sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered foliage and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water. Minuartia cismontana is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
